sn44.2:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
sn44.2:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

sn44.2:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā anurādho bhagavato avidūre araññakuṭikāyaṃ viharati.
sn44.2:1.2.eng: Now at that time Venerable Anurādha was staying not far from the Buddha in a wilderness hut.

sn44.2:1.3.pli: Atha kho sambahulā aññatitthiyā paribbājakā yenāyasmā anurādho tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā anurādhena saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
sn44.2:1.3.eng: Then several wanderers of other religions went up to Venerable Anurādha and exchanged greetings with him.

sn44.2:1.4.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā āyasmantaṃ anurādhaṃ etadavocuṃ:
sn44.2:1.4.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side and said to him:

sn44.2:1.5.pli: “yo so, āvuso anurādha, tathāgato uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto, taṃ tathāgato imesu catūsu ṭhānesu paññāpayamāno paññāpeti:
sn44.2:1.5.eng: “Reverend Anurādha, when a realized one is describing a realized one—a supreme person, highest of people, who has reached the highest point—they describe them in these four ways:

sn44.2:1.6.pli: ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā”ti?
sn44.2:1.6.eng: After death, a realized one still exists, or no longer exists, or both still exists and no longer exists, or neither still exists nor no longer exists.”

sn44.2:1.7.pli: “Yo so, āvuso, tathāgato uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto, taṃ tathāgato aññatra imehi catūhi ṭhānehi paññāpayamāno paññāpeti:
sn44.2:1.7.eng: “Reverends, when a realized one is describing a realized one—a supreme person, highest of people, who has reached the highest point—they describe them other than these four ways:

sn44.2:1.8.pli: ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā”ti.
sn44.2:1.8.eng: After death, a realized one still exists, or no longer exists, or both still exists and no longer exists, or neither still exists nor no longer exists.”

sn44.2:1.9.pli: Evaṃ vutte, te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā āyasmantaṃ anurādhaṃ etadavocuṃ:
sn44.2:1.9.eng: When he said this, the wanderers said to him,

sn44.2:1.10.pli: “so cāyaṃ bhikkhu navo bhavissati acirapabbajito, thero vā pana bālo abyatto”ti.
sn44.2:1.10.eng: “This mendicant must be junior, recently gone forth, or else a foolish, incompetent senior mendicant.”

sn44.2:1.11.pli: Atha kho te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā āyasmantaṃ anurādhaṃ navavādena ca bālavādena ca apasādetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamiṃsu.
sn44.2:1.11.eng: Then, after rebuking Venerable Anurādha by calling him “junior” and “foolish”, the wanderers got up from their seat and left.

sn44.2:2.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmato anurādhassa acirapakkantesu aññatitthiyesu paribbājakesu etadahosi:
sn44.2:2.1.eng: Soon after they had left, Anurādha thought,

sn44.2:2.2.pli: “sace kho maṃ te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā uttariṃ puccheyyuṃ,
sn44.2:2.2.eng: “If those wanderers were to inquire further,

sn44.2:2.3.pli: kathaṃ byākaramāno nu khvāhaṃ tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ vuttavādī ceva bhagavato assaṃ, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyaṃ, dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākareyyaṃ, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgaccheyyā”ti?
sn44.2:2.3.eng: how should I answer them so as to repeat what the Buddha has said, and not misrepresent him with an untruth? How should I explain in line with his teaching, so that there would be no legitimate grounds for rebuttal and criticism?”

sn44.2:2.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā anurādho yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā anurādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn44.2:2.4.eng: Then Venerable Anurādha went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.

sn44.2:2.6.pli: Atha kho, bhante, sambahulā aññatitthiyā paribbājakā yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā mayā saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.

sn44.2:2.7.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho, bhante, te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā maṃ etadavocuṃ:

sn44.2:2.8.pli: ‘yo so, āvuso anurādha, tathāgato uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto, taṃ tathāgato imesu catūsu ṭhānesu paññāpayamāno paññāpeti:

sn44.2:2.10.pli: “neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti vā’ti?

sn44.2:2.11.pli: Evaṃ vuttāhaṃ, bhante, te aññatitthiye paribbājake etadavocaṃ:

sn44.2:2.12.pli: ‘yo so, āvuso, tathāgato uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto, taṃ tathāgato aññatra imehi catūhi ṭhānehi paññāpayamāno paññāpeti:

sn44.2:2.14.pli: “neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti vā’ti.

sn44.2:2.15.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bhante, te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā maṃ etadavocuṃ:

sn44.2:2.16.pli: ‘so cāyaṃ bhikkhu navo bhavissati acirapabbajito thero vā pana bālo abyatto’ti.

sn44.2:2.17.pli: Atha kho maṃ, bhante, te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā navavādena ca bālavādena ca apasādetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamiṃsu.

sn44.2:2.18.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, acirapakkantesu tesu aññatitthiyesu paribbājakesu etadahosi:

sn44.2:2.19.pli: ‘sace kho maṃ te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā uttariṃ puccheyyuṃ, kathaṃ byākaramāno nu khvāhaṃ tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ vuttavādī ceva bhagavato assaṃ, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyaṃ, dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākareyyaṃ, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgaccheyyā’”ti?

sn44.2:5.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
sn44.2:5.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”

sn44.2:7.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ:
sn44.2:7.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:

sn44.2:7.2.eng: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”

sn44.2:11.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
sn44.2:11.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”

sn44.2:13.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ:
sn44.2:13.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:

sn44.2:13.2.eng: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”

sn44.2:15.1.pli: “Tasmātiha, anurādha, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atītānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ rūpaṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sn44.2:15.1.eng: “So, Anurādha, you should truly see any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; solid or subtle; inferior or superior; far or near: all form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

sn44.2:15.5.pli: yaṃ kiñci viññāṇaṃ atītānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ viññāṇaṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sn44.2:15.5.eng: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; solid or subtle; inferior or superior; far or near: all consciousness—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

sn44.2:15.6.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, anurādha, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmimpi nibbindati, vedanāyapi nibbindati, saññāyapi nibbindati, saṅkhāresupi nibbindati, viññāṇasmimpi nibbindati.
sn44.2:15.6.eng: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.

sn44.2:15.7.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sn44.2:15.7.eng: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

sn44.2:15.8.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
sn44.2:15.8.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’

sn44.2:16.2.eng: Do you regard a realized one as form?”

sn44.2:16.4.eng: “Do you regard a realized one as feeling …

sn44.2:16.13.eng: Do you regard a realized one as in form?”

sn44.2:16.15.eng: “Or do you regard a realized one as distinct from form?”

sn44.2:16.17.eng: “Do you regard a realized one as in feeling …

sn44.2:17.2.pli: rūpaṃ, vedanaṃ, saññaṃ, saṅkhāre, viññāṇaṃ tathāgatoti samanupassasī”ti?
sn44.2:17.2.eng: Do you regard a realized one as possessing form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness?”

sn44.2:17.5.pli: ayaṃ so arūpī avedano asaññī asaṅkhāro aviññāṇo tathāgatoti samanupassasī”ti?
sn44.2:17.5.eng: Do you regard a realized one as without form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness?”

sn44.2:17.7.pli: “Ettha ca te, anurādha, diṭṭheva dhamme saccato thetato tathāgate anupalabbhiyamāne kallaṃ nu te taṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ—
sn44.2:17.7.eng: “In that case, Anurādha, since a realized one is not found bu you as a genuine fact in this very life, is it cogent for you to declare:

sn44.2:17.8.pli: yo so, āvuso, tathāgato uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto, taṃ tathāgato aññatra imehi catūhi ṭhānehi paññāpayamāno paññāpeti:
sn44.2:17.8.eng: ‘Reverends, when a realized one is describing a realized one—a supreme person, highest of people, who has reached the highest point—they describe them other than these four ways:

sn44.2:17.9.eng: After death, a realized one still exists, or no longer exists, or both still exists and no longer exists, or neither still exists nor no longer exists’?”

sn44.2:17.10.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā”ti?

sn44.2:17.13.pli: Pubbe cāhaṃ, anurādha, etarahi ca dukkhañceva paññāpemi dukkhassa ca nirodhan”ti.
sn44.2:17.13.eng: In the past, as today, what I describe is suffering and the cessation of suffering.”

sn44.3:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto, āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
sn44.3:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Varanasi, in the deer park at Isipatana.

sn44.3:1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn44.3:1.2.eng: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita came out of retreat, went to Venerable Sāriputta, and exchanged greetings with him.

sn44.3:1.3.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:
sn44.3:1.3.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to Sāriputta:

sn44.3:2.1.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
sn44.3:2.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, does a realized one still exist after death?”

sn44.3:2.2.eng: “Reverend, this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.3:2.4.pli: “Kiṃ panāvuso, na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
sn44.3:2.4.eng: “Well then, does a realized one no longer exist after death? …

sn44.3:2.7.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
sn44.3:2.7.eng: Does a realized one both exist and not exist after death? …

sn44.3:2.9.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.

sn44.3:2.10.pli: “Kiṃ panāvuso, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
sn44.3:2.10.eng: Does a realized one neither exist nor not exist after death?”

sn44.3:2.11.eng: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.3:2.12.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.

sn44.3:3.1.pli: “‘Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti iti puṭṭho samāno, ‘abyākataṃ kho etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā—
sn44.3:3.1.eng: “Reverend, when asked these questions, you say that they have not been declared by the Buddha.

sn44.3:3.3.pli: ‘kiṃ panāvuso, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti iti puṭṭho samāno:

sn44.3:3.5.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vadesi.

sn44.3:3.6.pli: Ko nu kho, āvuso, hetu, ko paccayo yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
sn44.3:3.6.eng: What’s the cause, what’s the reason why they have not been declared by the Buddha?”

sn44.3:4.1.pli: “Hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti kho, āvuso, rūpagatametaṃ.
sn44.3:4.1.eng: “Reverend, ‘does a realized one still exist after death?’ is included in form.

sn44.3:4.2.pli: Na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, rūpagatametaṃ.
sn44.3:4.2.eng: ‘Does a realized one no longer exist after death?’ is included in form.

sn44.3:4.3.pli: Hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, rūpagatametaṃ.
sn44.3:4.3.eng: ‘Does a realized one both still exist and no longer exist after death?’ is included in form.

sn44.3:4.4.pli: Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, rūpagatametaṃ.
sn44.3:4.4.eng: ‘Does a realized one neither still exist nor no longer exist after death?’ is included in form.

sn44.3:4.5.pli: Hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti kho, āvuso, vedanāgatametaṃ.
sn44.3:4.5.eng: ‘does a realized one still exist after death?’ is included in feeling …

sn44.3:4.6.pli: Na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, vedanāgatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.7.pli: Hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, vedanāgatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.8.pli: Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, vedanāgatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.9.pli: Hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti kho, āvuso, saññāgatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.10.pli: Na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, saññāgatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.11.pli: Hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, saññāgatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.12.pli: Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, saññāgatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.13.pli: Hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti kho, āvuso, saṅkhāragatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.14.pli: Na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, saṅkhāragatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.15.pli: Hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, saṅkhāragatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.16.pli: Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, saṅkhāragatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.17.pli: Hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti kho, āvuso, viññāṇagatametaṃ.

sn44.3:4.18.pli: Na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, viññāṇagatametaṃ.
sn44.3:4.18.eng: ‘Does a realized one no longer exist after death?’ is included in consciousness.

sn44.3:4.19.pli: Hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, viññāṇagatametaṃ.
sn44.3:4.19.eng: ‘Does a realized one both still exist and no longer exist after death?’ is included in consciousness.

sn44.3:4.20.pli: Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti, viññāṇagatametaṃ.
sn44.3:4.20.eng: ‘Does a realized one neither still exist nor no longer exist after death?’ is included in consciousness.

sn44.3:4.21.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, hetu ayaṃ paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
sn44.3:4.21.eng: This is the cause, this is the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.4:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto, āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye …pe…
sn44.4:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Varanasi, in the deer park at Isipatana. …

sn44.4:1.3.pli: “Ko nu kho, āvuso, hetu, ko paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
sn44.4:1.3.eng: “What’s the cause, reverend, what’s the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha?”

sn44.4:1.4.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, āvuso, ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, rūpasamudayaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, rūpanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, rūpanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.4:1.4.eng: “Reverend, not truly knowing and seeing form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one thinks ‘a realized one still exists after death’ or

sn44.4:1.5.eng: ‘A realized one no longer exists after death’ or

sn44.4:1.6.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.4:1.6.eng: ‘a realized one both still exists and no longer exists after death’ or

sn44.4:1.7.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.4:1.7.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.4:1.8.eng: Not truly knowing or seeing feeling …

sn44.4:1.11.pli: viññāṇaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, viññāṇasamudayaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, viññāṇanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, viññāṇanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.4:1.11.eng: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one thinks ‘a realized one still exists after death’ or

sn44.4:1.12.eng: ‘A realized one no longer exists after death’ or

sn44.4:1.13.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.4:1.13.eng: ‘a realized one both still exists and no longer exists after death’ or

sn44.4:1.14.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”tipissa hoti.
sn44.4:1.14.eng: ‘A realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.4:2.1.pli: Rūpañca kho, āvuso, jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, rūpasamudayaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, rūpanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, rūpanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…

sn44.4:2.2.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.

sn44.4:2.6.pli: viññāṇaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, viññāṇasamudayaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, viññāṇanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, viññāṇanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti;
sn44.4:2.6.eng: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one doesn’t think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ or

sn44.4:2.7.pli: ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti;
sn44.4:2.7.eng: ‘A realized one no longer exists after death’ or

sn44.4:2.8.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti;
sn44.4:2.8.eng: ‘a realized one both still exists and no longer exists after death’ or

sn44.4:2.9.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.4:2.9.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.4:2.10.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, hetu ayaṃ paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
sn44.4:2.10.eng: This is the cause, this is the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.5:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto, āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye …pe…
sn44.5:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Varanasi, in the deer park at Isipatana. …

sn44.5:1.3.pli: “Ko nu kho, āvuso, hetu ko paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
sn44.5:1.3.eng: “What’s the cause, reverend, what’s the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha?”

sn44.5:1.4.pli: “Rūpe kho, āvuso, avigatarāgassa avigatacchandassa avigatapemassa avigatapipāsassa avigatapariḷāhassa avigatataṇhassa ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.5:1.4.eng: “Reverend, if you’re not rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for form …

sn44.5:1.5.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.

sn44.5:1.9.pli: viññāṇe avigatarāgassa avigatacchandassa avigatapemassa avigatapipāsassa avigatapariḷāhassa avigatataṇhassa ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.5:1.9.eng: consciousness, you think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.5:1.10.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.5:1.10.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.5:1.11.eng: If you are rid of greed for form …

sn44.5:1.15.pli: viññāṇe vigatarāgassa vigatacchandassa vigatapemassa vigatapipāsassa vigatapariḷāhassa vigatataṇhassa ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.5:1.15.eng: consciousness, you don’t think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.5:1.16.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.5:1.16.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.5:1.17.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
sn44.5:1.17.eng: This is the cause, this is the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.6:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto, āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
sn44.6:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Varanasi, in the deer park at Isipatana.

sn44.6:1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākoṭṭhikena saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn44.6:1.2.eng: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of retreat, went to Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita, and they greeted each other.

sn44.6:1.3.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ mahākoṭṭhikaṃ etadavoca:
sn44.6:1.3.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Mahākoṭṭhita:

sn44.6:1.4.pli: “‘kiṃ nu kho, āvuso koṭṭhika, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti …pe…
sn44.6:1.4.eng: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, does a realized one still exist after death?” …

sn44.6:1.5.pli: ‘kiṃ panāvuso, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti iti puṭṭho samāno:
sn44.6:1.5.eng: “Reverend, when asked these questions, you say that this has not been declared by the Buddha.

sn44.6:1.7.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vadesi.

sn44.6:1.8.pli: Ko nu kho, āvuso, hetu, ko paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
sn44.6:1.8.eng: What’s the cause, what’s the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha?”

sn44.6:2.1.pli: “Rūpārāmassa kho, āvuso, rūparatassa rūpasammuditassa rūpanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.6:2.1.eng: “Reverend, if you like, love, and enjoy form, and don’t truly see the cessation of form, you think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ or

sn44.6:2.2.eng: ‘A realized one no longer exists after death’ or

sn44.6:2.3.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.6:2.3.eng: ‘a realized one both still exists and no longer exists after death’ or

sn44.6:2.4.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:2.4.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.6:2.5.pli: Vedanārāmassa kho, āvuso, vedanāratassa vedanāsammuditassa, vedanānirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.6:2.5.eng: If you like, love, and enjoy feeling …

sn44.6:2.8.pli: viññāṇārāmassa kho, āvuso, viññāṇaratassa viññāṇasammuditassa viññāṇanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.6:2.8.eng: consciousness, and don’t truly see the cessation of consciousness, you think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.6:2.9.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:2.9.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.6:3.1.pli: Na rūpārāmassa kho, āvuso, na rūparatassa na rūpasammuditassa, rūpanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.6:3.1.eng: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy form …

sn44.6:3.2.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.

sn44.6:3.6.pli: na viññāṇārāmassa kho, āvuso, na viññāṇaratassa na viññāṇasammuditassa, viññāṇanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.6:3.6.eng: consciousness, and you truly see the cessation of consciousness, you don’t think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.6:3.7.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.6:3.7.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.6:3.8.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
sn44.6:3.8.eng: This is the cause, this is the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.6:4.1.pli: “Siyā panāvuso, aññopi pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
sn44.6:4.1.eng: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”

sn44.6:4.3.pli: Bhavārāmassa kho, āvuso, bhavaratassa bhavasammuditassa, bhavanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.6:4.3.eng: If you like, love, and enjoy existence, and don’t truly see the cessation of continued existence, you think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.6:4.4.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:4.4.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.6:4.5.pli: Na bhavārāmassa kho, āvuso, na bhavaratassa na bhavasammuditassa, bhavanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.6:4.5.eng: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy existence, and you truly see the cessation of continued existence, you don’t think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.6:4.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.6:4.6.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.6:4.7.pli: Ayampi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
sn44.6:4.7.eng: This too is a way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.6:5.1.pli: “Siyā panāvuso, aññopi pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
sn44.6:5.1.eng: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”

sn44.6:5.5.eng: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy grasping, and you truly see the cessation of grasping, you don’t think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.6:6.1.pli: “Siyā panāvuso, aññopi pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
sn44.6:6.1.eng: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”

sn44.6:6.3.pli: Taṇhārāmassa kho, āvuso, taṇhāratassa taṇhāsammuditassa, taṇhānirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.6:6.3.eng: If you like, love, and enjoy craving, and don’t truly see the cessation of craving, you think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.6:6.4.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:6.4.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.6:6.5.pli: Na taṇhārāmassa kho, āvuso, na taṇhāratassa na taṇhāsammuditassa, taṇhānirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.6:6.5.eng: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy craving, and you truly see the cessation of craving, you don’t think ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.6:6.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.6:6.6.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death.’

sn44.6:6.7.pli: Ayampi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.

sn44.6:7.1.pli: “Siyā panāvuso, aññopi pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
sn44.6:7.1.eng: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”

sn44.6:7.2.pli: “Ettha dāni, āvuso sāriputta, ito uttari kiṃ icchasi?
sn44.6:7.2.eng: “Seriously, reverend, what more could you want?

sn44.6:7.3.pli: Taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttassa, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhuno vaṭṭaṃ natthi paññāpanāyā”ti.
sn44.6:7.3.eng: For one who is freed due to the ending of craving, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.”
